_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

"Fundamental to our business is protecting our employees and customers, the communities in which we operate, and the environment. Lubrizol is committed to continual improvement in health, safety, environmental and security performance."
-- From: The Lubrizol Corporation Health, Safety, Environmental & Security Policy, February 2009

Lubrizol participates in Responsible CareA?, a program of the American Chemistry Council (ACC) launched in 1988.  Through Responsible CareA?, companies are committed to a continuing effort to improve the responsible management of chemicals. Accordingly, we believe and subscribe to the principles of the program including:

-       To design and develop products that can be manufactured, transported, used and disposed of or recycled safely.

-       To design and operate our facilities in a safe, secure and environmentally sound manner.

-       To instill a culture throughout all levels of our organizations to continually identify, reduce and manage process safety risks.

-       To support education and research on the health, safety, environmental effects and security of our products and processes.

-        To communicate product, service and process risks to our stakeholders and listen to and consider their perspectives.

-        To make continual progress towards our goal of no accidents, injuries or harm to human health and the environment from our products and operations and openly report our health, safety, environmental and security performance.

-        To seek continual improvement in our integrated Responsible Care Management SystemA? to address environmental, health, safety and security performance.

The Lubrizol Corporation Painesville Facility is registered to ISO 14001:2005 and RC 14001:2004 EHS&S management systems.   To achieve these certifications, a third party auditor conducts a formal pre-assessment followed by a final certification audit in order to certify that our management systems are functi

oning and conform to the international environmental standards for ISO 14001 and the ACC Technical Specification for RC 14001.
  
The Lubrizol CorporationA?s Painesville facility has integrated environmental, health, safety and security (EHS&S) responsibilities and accountability into the organization.  We believe that ownership for these issues is at the operating level and that safety is everyoneA?s job.  We are committed to operating our facility in compliance with applicable EHS&S laws and consistent with Responsible CareA?.  This is the philosophy that we communicate to our employees and that provides the grounding for our daily operations.  We believe that this philosophy is critical to our progress and a key contributor to the continued success of The Lubrizol Corporation, Painesville facility.

As part of the safety program, all new employees go through a safety orientation program. This includes but is not limited to the correct use of personal protection equipment, safe practices on the job and awareness and use of emergency equipment.

A training program is in place to train employees and contractors to reach and maintain proficiency in safe work practices and maintain the skills and knowledge necessary to perform their jobs. 

Multiple layers of protection are developed and put in place on all processes to prevent accidental releases. Equipment is expertly designed according to strict engineering standards. Safety reviews are conducted on new and modified processes and equipment during design and before start-up. A maintenance and inspection program is conducted and documented to ensure facility soundness.

Lubrizol's ongoing process safety program includes a measurement of performance, audits and implementation of corrective actions. This continuous management of the system assures that safety is always the top priority.

If an emergency were to occur, we have a trained and certified emergency response organization staffed 24 hours a day to immediately

react and mitigate the emergency. In addition, if we need additional assistance we have an established working relationship and direct communication with the local Lake County Fire Departments.


The facility and the regulated substances handled:
 
Lubrizol Painesville is a specialty manufacturing facility. We are a leading supplier of performance chemicals to international lubricant, fuel and industrial markets. Our processing areas consist of vessels and associated piping, valves and other ancillary equipment.
 
All of the chemicals listed below are used in processes to manufacture these products. The maximum quantity represents the maximum amount stored in a vessel and/or process at any time governed by administrative control through standard operating procedures.
 
The stationary source, the Lubrizol Corporation's (Lubrizol's) Painesville Plant facility I.D. number 0243000024, handles the following regulated substances:

Toxics:

CAS No.     Chemical name                                               Max.Qty. (Lbs.)

302-01-2    Propylene oxide [Oxirane, methyl-]                          180,000
108-05-4    Hydrazine                                                    78,000
7783-06-4   Hydrogen sulfide                                             32,000
75-56-9     Vinyl acetate monomer [Acetic acid ethenyl ester]             57,000
75-15-0     Carbon disulfide                                             87,000

Flammables:

CAS No.       Chemical name                                              Max.Qty. (Lbs.)

115-11-7       2-Methylpropene (IOB)                                    390,000



The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

Lubrizol's Painesville's facility is in compliance with the OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) rule and EPA's accident prevention rule. Some of the key elements are as follows:

For each covered process, associated process safety information is maintained, multiple layers of protection

are in place including safe design of equipment, emergency and control devices and instrumentation, safe operational procedures, monitoring equipment, back-up systems, maintenance and inspection programs and an established training system for all employees. All of these mechanisms are in place to prevent an accidental release.

The five-year accident history:

There were no incidents at the facility in the past five years that meet the definition of the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) reporting requirements.


The emergency response program:

Lubrizol maintains an Emergency Response Plan (ERP) at its facility located at 155 Freedom Rd., Painesville, Ohio 44077. There is an emergency response organization (ERO) in place twenty-four hours a day consisting of an incident commander and trained emergency responders. There are also certified hazardous material technicians, EMT's, rescue squad and paramedics on staff. The ERP is documented within Lubrizol Painesville's Intranet web site and is accessible to all Lubrizol-Painesville employees. The Plan includes procedures for the notification of local fire authorities and the local emergency planning committee (LEPC). The Lake County Emergency Management Agency maintains a public notification and alert system capable of notifying the surrounding community as needed. There is continuous training of LubrizolA?s ERO personnel on and off site and in conjunction with the local emergency responders. The ERP is updated as changes are needed.

Planned changes to improve safety:

An environmental, health and safety corrective action system exists to address all odors, spills, injuries and near misses at the facility. This system documents the incident and includes information on the root cause & mitigation measures and the individual responsible for implementing the corrective actions. A system is in place to review progress towards completion of the corrective actions and to check the effectiveness of these actions.

Safety meet

ings and training are held on a regular basis to review these incidents to update employees on topics that will improve the overall environmental, health and safety of our facility and surrounding community.     
                                                                                          All the RMP covered processes undergo a process hazard analysis on a routine basis to identify any potential hazards. If there are recommendation actions from these analyses, projects are initiated to address the recommendations as part of the facilityA?s capital improvement process.  Past projects related to RMP regulated processes have included upgrades to fire suppressant systems, level transmitters on vessels, replacement of liquid and vent piping, installation of safety barricades surrounding storage vessels, replacement of metering devices on material feed lines and installation of additional emergency equipment.

These are some examples of Lubrizol's philosophy of responsibly maintaining a safe environment for its employees and the surrounding community.
